title: SSENSE Sale 2024: 33 Discounted Design and Decor Picks You Should Definitely Buy
description: Among the streetwear-ish t-shirts and faux-leather mini skirts — SSENSE’s home section is packed with end-of-season deals as much as 70% off.
author: Audrey Lee, Leah Muncy
excerpt: Get these items from the annual SSENSE sale at up to 70% while the discounts last. Shop picks from Fellow, Houseplant, Tekla and more.
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Despite our best intentions to budget better, we simply can’t resist the SSENSE sale. If you’re recovering retail-therapy apologists like us, it’s hard to suppress the urge to splurge when you’re being offered a sweet home deal in return—especially if said deal means earning up to 70% off, which is exactly what SSENSE is offering right now (along with 25% off select rarely-on-sale homewares with code SHOP24) as part of their end of season sale.Before we dig into the deals, let’s break down how Canada-based SSENSE plays into the greater online shopping landscape. The retailer is best known for stocking a highly curated selection of goods to fill out your closet and home, from luxury brands like Jacquemus and Balenciaga to eco-conscious up-and-comers like Cou Cou Intimates and Deiji Studios. When it comes to the retailer’s home section, SSENSE prioritizes both style and functionality; only well-designed or tried-and-true products—often handmade from natural materials—make their way onto the site. (Labels include Fellow, Sophie Lou Jacobsen, Houseplant, Tekla, Okej, Loewe, Ferm Living, and more.) It’s an industry resource for uncovering new designers as much as it is a one-stop-shop for furnishing your apartment—and curating your wish list.The Best Picks from the SSENSE Sale:Best Home Accent Deal: Houseplant Black Strut Lamp (was $425, now $191)Best Kitchen and Tabletop Deal: Sophie Lou Jacobsen Teal Wave Pitcher (was $225, now $185)Best Soft Goods Deal: SUNNEI Green Striped Blanket (was $365, now $164)Best Furniture Deal: Polspotten Tam Tam Stool (was $365, now $274)Best Rug Deal: Mush Studios Small Oops Rug (was $400, now $344)Best Loungewear Deal: Emu Australia Tan Jolie Slippers (was $80, now &60Best Candle Deal: Clément Boutillon Candle & Candle Holder Set (was $140, now $83)Best Pet Deal: WE11DONE Grey Wool Check Anorak Shirt (was $425, now $170)For this season’s SSENSE sale, we picked 33 of the best items from the well-curated Everything Else section (which includes homewares like kitchen goods, rugs, and decor) that are currently up to 70% off.If you’re on the lookout for something specific, shop by category:Home AccentsKitchen and TabletopSoft Goods and BeddingFurnitureRugsLoungewearCandlesPetsHome Accent DealsSSENSE’s sale section is well-stocked with hard-to-find and handmade decor. The selection is full of designers and brands you know well, along with some up-and-comers, like Seth Rogen’s Houseplant. The retailer offers classic (and very giftable) kitchen gadgets and appliances from brands like Smeg, Fellow, and Alessi, but they also feature more experimental hand-crafted ceramics, flatware, and fine Italian glassware. We’re eyeing all of the coffee gadgets marked down, from sleek kettles to potentially the prettiest grinder we’ve ever seen. Not to mention, Natalia Criado’s splurge-worthy cutlery you’ll want to bring out for every dinner party. That includes designer camping goods, stylish bath mats, and the off-white throw blanket from Emma Chamberlain’s Open Door. While they carry some of our go-to brands, like Tekla and Baina, you can find other retailer-exclusive treasures nestled in the mix, like the ultracozy Sunnei green striped blanket.Baina Echo Bath MatTekla Pure New Wool BlanketSUNNEI Green Striped BlanketTekla Green Linen Table ClothStudio Variously Treacle ThrowFurnitureFashion-forward clothes and small decor make up much of the SSENSE stock—tailored blazers, cozy cardigans, and ceramic knickknacks abound—the site also sells a few larger furniture pieces from innovative brands like Muuto and Ann Demeulemeester, alongside classics like Herman Miller and Vitra. The majority of the furniture offerings are stools and small tables packing extra design flair. Take, for example, the Polspotten Zig Zag stool, which features a bold, sculptural silhouette and a punchy red hue. We’re also fond of the AML Stool from Frama—a Copenhagen-based brand that rarely goes on sale.Polspotten Tam Tam StoolFrama AML StoolPolspotten Zig Zag StoolRugsSSENSE’s rug offerings are unsurprisingly diverse, with patterns ranging from cobalt-blue checkerboard to off-white squiggles. The retailer offers a number of scented candles from favorite brands like DS & Durga and Maison Louis Marie, along with smaller and up-and-coming brands. While there’s a variety of scents on offer, all these candles are in beautiful vessels (the kind you’ll want to keep forever and turn into bathroom catchalls). There are also a variety of incense and equally cool incense holders on offer if you’d rather scent your space without an open flame. html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Despite our best intentions to budget better, we simply can’t resist the SSENSE sale. If you’re recovering retail-therapy apologists like us, it’s hard to suppress the urge to splurge when you’re being offered a sweet home deal in return—especially if said deal means earning up to 70% off, which is exactly what SSENSE is offering right now (along with 25% off select rarely-on-sale homewares with code SHOP24) as part of their end of season sale.

Before we dig into the deals, let’s break down how Canada-based SSENSE plays into the greater online shopping landscape. The retailer is best known for stocking a highly curated selection of goods to fill out your closet and home, from luxury brands like Jacquemus and Balenciaga to eco-conscious up-and-comers like Cou Cou Intimates and Deiji Studios. When it comes to the retailer’s home section, SSENSE prioritizes both style and functionality; only well-designed or tried-and-true products—often handmade from natural materials—make their way onto the site. (Labels include Fellow, Sophie Lou Jacobsen, Houseplant, Tekla, Okej, Loewe, Ferm Living, and more.) It’s an industry resource for uncovering new designers as much as it is a one-stop-shop for furnishing your apartment—and curating your wish list.

The Best Picks from the SSENSE Sale:

  • Best Home Accent Deal: Houseplant Black Strut Lamp (was $425, now $191)
  • Best Kitchen and Tabletop Deal: Sophie Lou Jacobsen Teal Wave Pitcher (was $225, now $185)
  • Best Soft Goods Deal: SUNNEI Green Striped Blanket (was $365, now $164)
  • Best Furniture Deal: Polspotten Tam Tam Stool (was $365, now $274)
  • Best Rug Deal: Mush Studios Small Oops Rug (was $400, now $344)
  • Best Loungewear Deal: Emu Australia Tan Jolie Slippers (was $80, now &60
  • Best Candle Deal: Clément Boutillon Candle & Candle Holder Set (was $140, now $83)
  • Best Pet Deal: WE11DONE Grey Wool Check Anorak Shirt (was $425, now $170)

For this season’s SSENSE sale, we picked 33 of the best items from the well-curated Everything Else section (which includes homewares like kitchen goods, rugs, and decor) that are currently up to 70% off.

If you’re on the lookout for something specific, shop by category:

  • Home Accents
  • Kitchen and Tabletop
  • Soft Goods and Bedding
  • Furniture
  • Rugs
  • Loungewear
  • Candles
  • Pets

Home Accent Deals

SSENSE’s sale section is well-stocked with hard-to-find and handmade decor. Think vintage-inspired amber glass; bold mirrors; and whimsical, colorful objets d’art up to 70% off. The selection is full of designers and brands you know well, along with some up-and-comers, like Seth Rogen’s Houseplant. (We were also surprised to find Vitruvi’s Stone Diffuser—an AD staff favorite—for 25% off with code SHOP24 at checkout.)

Vitruvi Stone Diffuser

MENU Orange Large Échasse Bowl

Houseplant Strut Lamp

Forma Rosa Studio Wave Form Vase

Kitchen and Tabletop Deals

The tabletop is where SSENSE’s Everything Else section really shines. The retailer offers classic (and very giftable) kitchen gadgets and appliances from brands like Smeg, Fellow, and Alessi, but they also feature more experimental hand-crafted ceramics, flatware, and fine Italian glassware. We’re eyeing all of the coffee gadgets marked down, from sleek kettles to potentially the prettiest grinder we’ve ever seen. Not to mention, Natalia Criado’s splurge-worthy cutlery you’ll want to bring out for every dinner party. Sophie Lou Jacobsen’s popular wave pitcher makes a great vessel for flowers and big batch cocktails alike.

Fellow Ode Brew Grinder

Natalia Criado Gold Stone Cutlery Set

Sophie Lou Jacobsen Teal Wave Pitcher

Smeg Retro-Style 2-Slice Toaster

Soft Good Deals

Whether you’re looking to refresh your bedding, stock up on new bath towels, or find a new throw blanket for the couch, there are a wide range of options currently on sale. That includes designer camping goods, stylish bath mats, and the off-white throw blanket from Emma Chamberlain’s Open Door. While they carry some of our go-to brands, like Tekla and Baina, you can find other retailer-exclusive treasures nestled in the mix, like the ultracozy Sunnei green striped blanket.

Baina Echo Bath Mat

Tekla Pure New Wool Blanket

SUNNEI Green Striped Blanket

Tekla Green Linen Table Cloth

Studio Variously Treacle Throw

Furniture

Fashion-forward clothes and small decor make up much of the SSENSE stock—tailored blazers, cozy cardigans, and ceramic knickknacks abound—the site also sells a few larger furniture pieces from innovative brands like Muuto and Ann Demeulemeester, alongside classics like Herman Miller and Vitra. The majority of the furniture offerings are stools and small tables packing extra design flair. Take, for example, the Polspotten Zig Zag stool, which features a bold, sculptural silhouette and a punchy red hue. We’re also fond of the AML Stool from Frama—a Copenhagen-based brand that rarely goes on sale.

Polspotten Tam Tam Stool

Frama AML Stool

Polspotten Zig Zag Stool

Rugs

SSENSE’s rug offerings are unsurprisingly diverse, with patterns ranging from cobalt-blue checkerboard to off-white squiggles. If your design tastes lean abstract, we’d suggest picking up a piece from the internet-famous brand Okej, or the designer-favorite Ferm Living. Each pick looks distinct, whether that’s thanks to its shape or intriguing design. (Plus, if you’re short on floor space, any of these rugs would look just as handsome hung on the wall.)

Mush Studios Small Oops Rug

Muuto Ply Rug

Ferm Living Mara Rug

Accessories & Loungewear

Gifting season should be top of mind when browsing the womenswear and menswear side of the SSENSE sale this time of year. Tekla bathrobes and shearling-lined slippers make thoughtful gifts for loved ones, though you may need to pick up this all-leather tote bag from Dragon Diffusion just for yourself. (Some items may require the code SHOP24 for the discount to appear at checkout.)

Dragon Diffusion Triple Jump Big Tote

EMU Australia Jolie Slippers

Sporty & Rich French Lounge Pants

Sleeper White Party Pyjama Set

OTTI Pink Drawstring Hoodie

Tekla Original Bathrobe

Entire Studios Heavy Sweatpants

Candles

The candle sales at SSENSE are pages and pages worth of scrolling fodder. The retailer offers a number of scented candles from favorite brands like DS & Durga and Maison Louis Marie, along with smaller and up-and-coming brands. While there’s a variety of scents on offer, all these candles are in beautiful vessels (the kind you’ll want to keep forever and turn into bathroom catchalls). There are also a variety of incense and equally cool incense holders on offer if you’d rather scent your space without an open flame. We’d also strongly recommend checking out their unique accent candles that lean into funky shapes and bright colors. They’re sort of the star of the show, from the quirky and colorful to the muted and almost-sexual, they’ll certainly light up your room in more ways than one.

Soft-Geometry Tall Gola Candle

Clément Boutillon Candle & Candle Holder Set

D.S. & Durga Lightable Latkes Candle

Maison Louis Marie No.08 La Petite Louise Candle

Pets

Designy pet supplies are hard to come by, especially at a discount. (And while your dog may not need a $332 denim harness from Marine Serre, she certainly would look a whole lot more stylish.) Our favorites from SSENSE’s curated sale selection include leather waste-bag holders and a black-and-white plaid pet coat.

Pagerie 'The Pochette' Pouch

Pets So Good Linden Pet Day Bed

We11done Wool Check Anorak Shirt
